Title: Terminal Manager
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $91,875 - $101,325* however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
We are looking for a talented and driven Home Delivery Operations Terminal Manager to join us and lead our Kent Delivery Operations. You will lead a team of Supervisors, Associates/Specialists, and Driver Partners serving our customers in your delivery area.  
Weve been busy building a best-in-class logistics network that allows us to delight customers by speeding up deliveries, adding specialized services, and reducing damage. 
Home Delivery Site Leader is a fantastic spot to start your Wayfair journey. We have ambitious plans for over the next 5 years, so opportunities for growth will be plentiful for those who want them!
What Youll Do

Assume full responsibility for the safety, customer experience, employee experience, quality, and cost of your Home Delivery Operation Terminal - this is your site - get excited to Be an Owner
Provide inspirational leadership and guidance to your team of Wayfair Warehouse and Wayfair Transportation employees, inclusive of leaders and frontline staff
Build a partnership with our Delivery Partners ensuring your operation has the needed outbound capacity and provides an exceptional home delivery customer experience
Drive results for your building across a comprehensive and balanced set of performance metrics (e.g., Safety, Customer, Employee, Quality, Cost)
Develop your people by relentlessly focusing on skill development and career pathing
Collaborate with several core stakeholders and ensure your building has what it needs to be successful (e.g., Safety, Talent Mgt, Talent Acquisition, Transportation, Training, Workforce Planning, Technology, to name a few...)
Champion change for your team - we are always improving and we move fast

What You'll Need

Ownership mentality and motivation to build the best team
Strong leadership skills and ability to collaborate effectively with cross functional teams
Ability to proactively identify opportunities and implement solutions; lean/six sigma a plus
Comfort with delivery routing technologies/strategies and warehouse management systems
Comfort with raw data sets as well as creating simple but useful templates in google sheets
BA/BS in management, administration, supply chain, or customer service.
5+ years working experience in fulfillment, distribution, home delivery or transportation
Bilingual is a plus

Title: Tax Senior Associate
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position).
Wayfairs Finance group is looking for a Tax Senior  to join our tax team! This role will be part of the global tax team within the Wayfair Finance Department, and it will be based on our Boston office. This role is an excellent opportunity for a professional with a strong foundation in federal and state tax compliance to contribute to the tax function. The successful candidate will play a key role in the team, gaining exposure to many areas of tax.
The Tax team at Wayfair is responsible for the global corporate tax and transfer pricing compliance, strategically planning to minimize tax burdens, and diligently managing associated risks. Reporting directly to the Senior Tax Manager, the Tax Senior will be responsible for state and federal tax returns and extension filings, preparing income tax provisions, and assisting with tax audits. Members of this team work closely with various other teams and departments and this role requires someone who has strong tax technical knowledge and good communication skills. This role will give exposure to different areas of tax, and if you are someone with a passion for tax and learning, this could be the role for you!
What You'll Do

Prepare and manage U.S. federal and state income tax filings and estimated payments, ensuring compliance with evolving tax laws and deadlines.
Assist in the preparation of quarterly and annual income tax provisions in accordance with ASC 740, supporting timely and accurate financial reporting.
Support income tax audits by preparing documentation, responding to inquiries, and coordinating with external advisors and auditors.
Partner with internal stakeholders and external auditors to ensure compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) requirements and maintain accurate, audit-ready tax records.
Contribute to ad-hoc tax projects, including research and analysis of tax law changes, business initiatives, and cross-functional planning efforts.
Leverage technology and automation tools to improve tax processes and enhance operational efficiency in a dynamic, high-growth environment.

What You'll Need

A bachelors degree in commerce, accounting, taxation or a related field.
4+ years experience in public or private accounting, working in the tax department.
Experience with federal and state tax compliance with a strong technical background.
Experience working with ONESOURCE tax provision software, or an equivalent tax provision software system.
Masters in taxation or CPA is preferred but not required.

No-cost access to 2nd.MD, a virtual expert medical consultation and navigation service.
Global Traveler Health Insurance through GeoBlue.

401(k) matching with immediate vesting.

Title: Supplier Acquisition Manager
RoleDescription:
Were seeking a highly analytical, passionate, and self-motivated team manager to join our Wayfair Global selling team. We are a nimble, fast-paced, ambitious team and drive real-time, material impact on the business. You must have an interest in innovating to solve business problems creatively and a willingness to hit the ground running.
For this role, we are seeking a problem-solving, entrepreneurial team manager to manage the supplier acquisition and business partnership development for our Asia-based Supplier program. In this role, youll work with external partners, our suppliers, and internal cross-functional teams to set up and onboard suppliers onto Wayfair. Lead a vertical acquisition team on Wayfair
Managing relationships with our external partners who provide supplier leads and resources
Build up yearly marketing plans to strengthen the lead generation and enhance the local network.
Communicating with target suppliers as needed throughout the setup process
Problem solves challenges or trends as they arise
Report on progress of the Acquisition team, including successes and learnings
Work with cross-functional teams to drive a better supplier experience
Set up the strategy and executive planning for the Asia-based Supplier Acquisition team
Drive the solution based on suppliers requirements and lead multi programs.

What You'll Need 

8 years out of undergrad with relevant work or experience (strong preference for experience within an e-commerce organization), along with at least 5 years team management experience
Experience in managing a team of 3 or more people.
Fluency in English both written and verbal
Ability to communicate and feel comfortable speaking directly with owners and executives of large companies
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results
Collaborative by nature; ability to build relationships and buy-in to drive change effectively in a positive manner
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects
An analytical thinker who looks for and finds answers in the data
Ability to hit the ground running  a self-starter capable of achieving specific targets
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset
Experience in SQL and advanced Excel capabilities is a plus, but not required

Title: Sr. Category Manager
RoleDescription:
Who We Are:
Wayfair is reinventing the way people shop for their homes and our team is tasked with building a best-in-class eCommerce business across our Asia market. Externally, we manage supplier relationships, partnering to build e-commerce strategies with industry leading manufacturers and supporting them in their execution. Internally, we work closely with our operations team (supply chain, logistics, automation etc), and additionally steer high-level strategy with our Buying, Merchandising, Pricing and Marketing teams, to drive results for our categories and suppliers.
We are looking for several Shanghai based Senior Category Managers to help us profitably build and grow our Asia market. You will be expected to define overarching goals and strategy for your category, problem-solve, articulate and execute against tactical plans, and manage key business metrics. Category Managers must be able to expertly negotiate internally and externally, while also being effective cross-functional project managers.
What You'll Do:

Develop and manage category strategy in alignment with Wayfair business goals and collaborate across geographies with the North America and European category teams for your relevant categories.
Manage a portfolio of Asia based suppliers within the category, driving supplier development by setting strategic goals, negotiating business terms and reviewing performance
Analyze supplier and category performance to determine tactical next steps and strategic vision, involving the relevant cross-functional teams (e.g. operations)
Negotiate frequently with existing suppliers to optimize performance and cost base, exclusivity, advertising and other strategic initiatives from Wayfair.
Be a senior internal and external escalation point, often involving negotiations with C-suite members from our external partners
Identify trends, problems, and opportunities for either the category or supplier segment, and collaborate with internal teams to drive change
Managing team members, able to provide guidance and directions towards junior members in the team and lead the team to accomplished target

What You'll Need

Fluent in both Mandarin and English
A track record of success in developing relationships with stakeholders, working collaboratively and negotiating to drive multi-departmental projects.
Analytical mindset and data-driven approach: demonstrated experience working with complex data to develop robust commercial recommendations
Demonstrated success in building business relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Track record of leading successful commercial negotiations
Advanced level Excel and PowerPoint expertise
Demonstrated ability to work within a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment
Innovative problem-solving skills; dissecting and determining the root causes of problems and implementing solutions
Experience in an eCommerce or management consulting environment is advantageous

Title: Pricing Manager
RoleDescription:
Pricing Manager London | UK & Ireland Focus Full-Time | MondayThursday in the office (EC1V 7LQ)
Own the Numbers. Drive the Strategy. Maximise Profit.
At Wayfair, were transforming how the world shops for home and behind every great customer experience is a smart commercial strategy. As our new Pricing Strategy Manager for the UK & Ireland, youll play a critical role in shaping pricing and investment strategies that drive sustainable growth, supplier success and bottom-line impact.
 What Youll Do


Optimise Profit Margins: Design and implement pricing strategies that balance customer value and long-term profitability across markets.


Run the Numbers: Leverage promotional levers, brand pricing initiatives, and supplier investment strategies to improve financial performance.


Forecast Like a Pro: Partner with Finance to lead profitability planning, scenario modeling, and sensitivity analysis to support strategic planning.

Partner Cross-Functionally: Work across Finance, Marketing, Supplier Partnerships, Engineering, and Analytics to align strategies and improve tools.


Mentor & Lead: Guide junior analysts and foster a high-performance culture within a collaborative 5-person team.

Proven experience in pricing, finance, analytics, strategy consulting, or a similarly quantitative field


Proven ability to work with and interpret large datasets to influence commercial strategy


Proficiency in SQL, BigQuery, Excel, and other analytical tools (Python/R a plus)


Strong business acumen and commercial intuition - you understand how pricing impacts customer behaviour, supplier performance, and business goals


A natural problem-solver who thrives in ambiguity and enjoys turning data into strategic action


Excellent stakeholder management and communication skills - confident working across levels and departments


Background in eCommerce, retail, or consumer goods is beneficial but not essential

Wayfair is one of the worlds largest online destinations for home goods. To deliver an exceptional customer experience at scale, we rely heavily on machine learning and AI systems that power everything from delivery date prediction to multi-modal systems for visual diagnostics to agentic workflow automation.
As an ML Engineer within the Supply Chain and Retail Tech AI org, youll be at the forefront of transforming Wayfair Supply Chain and Support operations by developing robust, reliable and production-grade ML and AI systems. You will work closely with ML scientists to launch highly impactful and scalable ML models leveraging modern MLOps best practice and tools. Wayfair is seeking a highly organized and agile Senior Associate to join our Creative Operations team, supporting project and production operations across both Performance Creative (paid social, search, programmatic) and our expanding Owned & Operated channels (email, push, SMS). Who We Are
The Creative Operations team serves as the business owner of our Creative Group. This team drives the long-term strategy, scaling and day-to-day workflow for our diverse set of brands.  With hundreds of initiatives a month spanning all mediums, channels and disciplines, we are the driving force enabling our Creative talent to efficiently and effectively bring our brands to life with eye-catching visuals, strong messaging, and engaging storytelling. 
What Youll Do

Manage creative sprints supporting Performance Marketing and other high volume test & learn initiatives, ensuring projects are briefed, resourced, reviewed by appropriate parties, and delivered correctly and on time
Translate business goals and creative direction into executable timelines and workflows across a variety of asset types and channels
Act as a key cross-functional partner to Creative, Marketing, and Operations, facilitating day-to-day delivery while aligning on larger priorities and testing roadmaps
Collaborate with team leads on roadmap planning, sprint prioritization, and resource forecasting
Own project management systems (e.g., Airtable), driving usage, visibility, and data hygiene
Identify and escalate risks, blockers, or misalignments early, and help problem-solve in real time
Contribute to improving operational processes, sprint cadences, and creative testing systems
Act as a super user and power collaborator across our core tools and platforms, bringing a tech-forward mindset to every sprint
Support the development and maintenance of scalable creative systems (e.g., naming conventions, asset versioning protocols, metadata tagging) to enable performance reporting and automation

5+ years of experience in a strategy or operational role with a strong track record using data to identify insights, creating new processes, influencing, and driving results.

Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate effectively at all levels of the organization and across different teams.
A strategic thinker who thrives in ambiguity and is excited by the opportunity to shape and define a new area.

Title: Senior Designer, Cabinetry & Home Renovation
RoleDescription:
Senior Retail Designer, Cabinetry & Home Renovation
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Overview:At Wayfair, we believe a home should be as functional as it is beautifuland that starts with great design. As a Sr. Retail Designer  Cabinetry and Home Renovation, you'll turn customer visions into reality, guiding them through their renovation journey with confidence, creativity, and care. From kitchens and bathrooms to laundry rooms and custom built-ins, you'll craft smart, stylish spaces that reflect each customers goals, budget, and style.
Youll tap into your expertise in cabinetry, bath, and kitchen design. Youll lean into Wayfairs expansive product catalog from cabinetry and tile to flooring and plumbing to provide complete solutions for DIY homeowners and professional contractors alike. If you're a proactive problem-solver with a passion for design and sales, and you love seeing a great project come to life, this is your stage.
What Does A Cabinetry and Home Renovation Designer Do?

 Own the Design Process: Lead cabinetry and home renovation projects from concept to completion. Use 2020 Design Live or similar software to develop layout plans, renderings, and product recommendations based on customer inputs, measurements, and needs.
 Be the Technical Expert: Educate customers on cabinetry construction types (framed vs. frameless), materials (MDF, plywood, solid wood), finishes (painted, stained, laminated), and specialty features (soft-close hinges, pull-outs, and more).
 Deliver Personalized Consultations: Whether it's in-store, virtual, or in-home, you'll meet customers where they are. You'll listen deeply, learn their style and renovation goals, and recommend functional, beautiful solutions tailored to their timeline and budget.
 Connect the Dots from Start to Finish: Develop floor plans, mood boards, 3D visuals, and complete product packages. You'll manage each projects full lifecyclefrom early design to final purchaseand offer support through post-order services to ensure a smooth renovation experience.
 Educate + Inspire: Stay ahead of design trends and new materials, bringing fresh ideas to every customer interaction. Help customers see how tile, flooring, kitchen, bath, and plumbing products can work together to create the space theyve dreamed of.
 Leverage Design + Sales Tools: Use analytics and digital tools to build persuasive space plans, presentations, and shopping experiences that help grow the business while putting your creativity to work.
 Thrive in a Dynamic Environment: With evolving customer needs, product assortments, and promotions, youll stay focused, flexible, and ready to pivotall while delivering high-impact experiences.
 Always Be Selling (ABS): Every interaction is an opportunity. Youll generate new leads, build customer rapport, and close on personalized solutions that help grow your pipeline and the stores performance.
 Contribute to Store Success: Help with visual updates, floor sets, and inventory tasks as neededand bring your ideas to the table! Were a team that builds (and wins) together.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Design Experience: 3+ years of experience in kitchen, bath, cabinetry, or home renovation design. You know your way around spatial planning, product selection, and what works (and what wows). Bonus points for 12 years focused on cabinetry.
 Technical Proficiency: Youre confident working in design software like 2020, AutoCAD, Revit, SketchUp, or similar tools. Familiarity with CRM/POS systems (like Salesforce) helps too.
 Sales Know-How: Youve got a track record of meeting or beating your sales goalsand you know how to build trust while selling big ideas and beautiful designs.

Title: Senior Associate, Labor Planning
RoleDescription:
This role is an onsite position based out of one of our Final Mile Centers in Norton, MA or Linden, NJ. 
The Senior Associate of Labor Planning plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site(s) specific goals across Wayfair. They partner with others to ensure timely and cost efficient processing of the orders.
What You'll Do

You will create weekly and daily operating plans for site(s) and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for site plans at this cadence to align with Site leadership and network priorities.
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to short-mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements
You must be authorized to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future.

Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Title: Economist II - Machine Learning Science, Search & Recommendations
RoleDescription:
Who we are
Wayfair is an online retail platform with the mission to enable everyone to live in a home they love.  To do this, Wayfair builds and leverages cutting edge Machine Learning and AI products, and we are looking for talented individuals to join us.  We build our systems from the ground up with economic fundamentals in mind. Wayfairs Search, Marketing, and Recommendations ML teams build algorithmic systems that drive our business, enhance customer experience, and improve customer loyalty, powering what our customers see on and off our site at web scale. You will be part of a high-leverage Sort MLS squad - a cross-functional, collaborative team driving development of world-class ML systems with company-wide impact.
What youll do

Own the ranking algorithm and simulation engine that decides which of the millions of products we show to millions of Wayfair shoppers, improving customer satisfaction and company revenue.
Design, build, deploy, and iterate large-scale decision systems including the sort algorithm, exploration strategies, predictive and counterfactual models.
Redesign our two-sided marketplace and develop incentive-compatible sort algorithms.
Partner with Engineering, Infra, and ML Platform teams to productionize and deploy scalable, reliable services following best practices (CI/CD, monitoring, A/B gating).
Collaborate with Product, Data Science, and Business stakeholders to turn business opportunities into launched models and measure their impact.
Discover new opportunities and levers through data exploration and simulation, and deliver end-to-end solutions from proposal to production to monitoring. 

What Youll Need

Ph.D. in Economics or a closely related field (e.g., Marketing, Finance, Operations Research, Statistics) with 0-3 years of experience.
Expertise in marketplace dynamics, profit maximization, simulation, or causal inference.
Experience with ML models and approaches (deep learning, tree-based models, exploration, bandit algorithms).
Proficiency in Python or one other high-level programming language.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, ability to synthesize conclusions for non-experts, and overall bias towards simplicity.
Intellectual curiosity and enthusiasm about continuous learning.

Nice to Have

Experience with Python ML ecosystem (mumpy, pandas, sklearn, XGBoost, etc.) and/or Apache Spark Ecosystem (Spark SQL, MLlib/Spark ML).
Familiarity with GCP (or AWS, Azure), ML model development frameworks, ML orchestration tools (Airflow, Kubeflow, or MLflow).

Raise technical standards across the team by promoting best practices in ML system design and development.

Research and apply best practices in advertising science, GenAI applications in creative personalization, and auction modeling. Keep Wayfair at the forefront of innovation in supplier marketing optimization.

Bachelor's or Masters degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field.
9+ years of experience in building large scale machine learning algorithms.
4+ years of experience working in an architect or technical leadership position. 
Strong theoretical understanding of statistical models such as regression, clustering and ML algorithms such as decision trees, neural networks, transformers and NLP techniques. 
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python and relevant ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) to develop production-grade products.
Strategic thinker with a customer-centric mindset and a desire for creative problem solving, looking to make a big impact in a growing organization.

Ability to partner cross-functionally to own and shape technical roadmaps Intellectual curiosity and a desire to always be learning!

Nice to have:

Experience with GCP, Airflow, and containerization (Docker).
Experience building scalable data processing pipelines with big data tools such as Hadoop, Hive, SQL, Spark, etc.
Familiarity with Generative AI and agentic workflows.
Experience in Bayesian Learning, Multi-armed Bandits, or Reinforcement Learning.
